channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [GROOVY-2787] typing "x.class" in groovysh changes x.
item.description:
Groovy Shell (1.6-beta-1-SNAPSHOT, JVM: 1.6.0_05)
Type 'help' or '\h' for help.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
groovy:000> x = 'foo'
===> foo
groovy:000> binding.x
===> foo
groovy:000> x.class
===> class java.lang.String
groovy:000> binding.x
ERROR java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to java.lang.Class

Once you do x.class it is then in a broken state.
Strangely enough, doing 'println x.class' is fine.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:

I changed the affect version and the fix versions, because the shell is doing fine in 1.5.6 and later. Seems like the 1.6 versions is the one that has the problem... which I will test in a few moments
